chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall kappa : Cardinal, exists lambda : Cardinal, gt_cardinal lambda kappa

Premises:
gt_cardinal = fun kappa lambda : Cardinal => lt_cardinal lambda kappa : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop
Inductive Cardinal : Type := cardinality : Type -> Cardinal Arguments cardinality _%type_scope
le_cardinal_antisym : forall kappa lambda : Cardinal, le_cardinal kappa lambda -> le_cardinal lambda kappa -> eq_cardinal kappa lambda
eq_cardinal_impl_le_cardinal : forall kappa lambda : Cardinal, eq_cardinal kappa lambda -> le_cardinal kappa lambda
lt_cardinal = fun kappa lambda : Cardinal => le_cardinal kappa lambda /\ ~ eq_cardinal kappa lambda : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop
ge_cardinal = fun kappa lambda : Cardinal => le_cardinal lambda kappa : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop
Cardinal_rec : forall P : Cardinal -> Set, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
Cardinal_ind : forall P : Cardinal -> Prop, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
Cardinal_rect : forall P : Cardinal -> Type, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
Cardinal_sind : forall P : Cardinal -> SProp, (forall T : Type, P (cardinality T)) -> forall c : Cardinal, P c
le_cardinal_sind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> SProp, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), injective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, le_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
le_cardinal_ind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), injective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, le_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
eq_cardinal_sind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> SProp, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), bijective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, eq_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
eq_cardinal_ind : forall P : Cardinal -> Cardinal -> Prop, (forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y), bijective f -> P (cardinality X) (cardinality Y)) -> forall c c0 : Cardinal, eq_cardinal c c0 -> P c c0
CSB : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (g : Y -> X), injective f -> injective g -> exists h : X -> Y, bijective h
BinNat.N.log2_eq_succ_is_pow2 : forall a : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.log2 (BinNat.N.succ a) = BinNat.N.succ (BinNat.N.log2 a) -> exists b : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.succ a = BinNat.N.pow (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) b
surjective = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) => forall y : Y, exists x : X, f x = y : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Prop Arguments surjective {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
BinNat.N.divide = fun p q : BinNums.N => exists r : BinNums.N, q = BinNat.N.mul r p : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.divide (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.divide = fun x y : BinNums.Z => exists z : BinNums.Z, y = BinInt.Z.mul z x : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
BinNat.N.Odd = fun n : BinNums.N => exists m : BinNums.N, n = BinNat.N.add (BinNat.N.mul (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) m) (BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH) : BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.Odd _%N_scope
ssreflect.external_view_sind : forall P : ssreflect.external_view -> SProp, (forall T : Type, P (ssreflect.tactic_view T)) -> forall e : ssreflect.external_view, P e
reflexive = fun (A : Type) (R : relation A) => forall x : A, R x x : forall A : Type, relation A -> Prop Arguments reflexive {A}%type_scope
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x...
ClassicalFacts.or_indd : forall (A B : Prop) (P : A \/ B -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (or_introl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (or_intror b)) -> forall o : A \/ B, P o
Relation_Operators.clos_refl_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : relation A) (x : A) (P : A -> Prop), (forall y : A, R x y -> P y) -> P x -> forall a : A, Relation_Operators.clos_refl A R x a -> P a
eq_rect_eq_on__eq_dep1_eq_on : forall (U : Type) (p : U) (P : U -> Type) (y : P p), Eq_rect_eq_on U p P y -> forall x : P p, eq_dep1 U P p x p y -> x = y
symmetric = fun (A : Type) (R : relation A) => forall x y : A, R x y -> R y x : forall A : Type, relation A -> Prop Arguments symmetric {A}%type_scope
Relation_Operators.rt_refl : forall (A : Type) (R : relation A) (x : A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A R x x
Eq_rect_eq_on : forall (U : Type) (p : U) (Q : U -> Type), Q p -> Prop
Eq_dep_eq_on : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Type) (p : U), P p -> Prop
ssrbool.predPredType : forall T : Type, ssrbool.predType T
BinNat.N.case_analysis : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A BinNums.N0 -> (forall n : BinNums.N, A (BinNat.N.succ n)) -> forall n : BinNums.N, A n

```coq
Lemma gt_cardinal_exists : forall kappa : Cardinal, exists lambda : Cardinal, gt_cardinal lambda kappa.
Proof.
  intros kappa.
  apply Cardinal_rec.
  - intro T.
    exists (cardinality T).
    apply gt_cardinal_surjective.
  Qed.
```
